article_title: SUV driver dies in fiery crash in South Dallas
article_text:
An SUV driver died in a fiery crash in South Dallas early Saturday, police said.

The crash occurred about 1:35 a.m. near the intersection of South Lamar and Corinth streets.

A witness told police that a late 1900s model Ford Expedition was speeding on Corinth Street and crashed into a bridge while turning on South Lamar, police said.

The silver-colored SUV burst into flames, and the driver died inside.

Police said they haven’t been able to identify the driver because of his or her burn injuries.

Police said they haven’t been able to identify the driver because of his or her burn injuries.
